title: 110_hr3786
content: The "Servicemembers Telecom Contract Relief Act" allows servicemembers to terminate telecommunications contracts entered into before a permanent change of station or deployment orders. This amendment adds a new section to the Servicemembers Civil Relief Act for this purpose. The "Servicemembers Telecom Contract Relief Act" allows military personnel to terminate telecommunications contracts if they enter military service for a period of at least 90 days. The "Servicemembers Telecom Contract Relief Act" permits military personnel to terminate contracts if they enter military service for at least 90 days, or receive orders extending their service to 90 days. Termination requires written notice and military orders to the other party. The "Servicemembers Telecom Contract Relief Act" allows military personnel to terminate contracts by providing written notice and military orders to the other party. Delivery of notice can be done by hand, private carrier, or mail with return receipt requested. Contract termination is effective on the day the notice is delivered. Upon termination of a contract by a person in military service, unpaid amounts preceding the termination date must be paid on a prorated basis. Relief granted to the military member under this section can be modified by a court if deemed just and equitable. Any person who unlawfully seizes or withholds property of a military member terminating a contract covered by this section may face penalties, including misdemeanor charges. Upon termination of a contract by a person in military service, any attempt to subject the property to contract payments after termination may result in fines or imprisonment. The remedy provided in this section is in addition to other available legal remedies, including consequential or punitive damages. "Sec. 309. Termination of telecommunications contracts."
